title: (x) puls - Gillies Gothic {Mark S}
content:
The following font has somewhere else been identified as Kaufmann. I'm to believe that it isn't though (it doesn't quite seem to...) so my doubt remains. Anyone who can help? Grateful.   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071109063209im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/25181.gif)

 [‹ (x) Bas](http://web.archive.org/web/20071109063209/http:/www.typophile.com/node/2869 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Chelsea Girls - Bookman Swash {Adriano S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071109063209/http:/www.typophile.com/node/2914 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ssmm

comments.content: Definitely not Kaufmann, closer to [Raceway](http://web.archive.org/web/20071109063209/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/raceway/) but not exactly that either. Could be a free Raceway knockoff.
Nah. That's [Gillies Gothic Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20071109063209/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/gillies-gothic/light/testdrive.html?s=puls&p=72), spaced rather tightly.

Assuming this is just a logo, the bulge in the right upright of the 'u' suggests to me that this is   
custom drawn. A font maker would likely have kept the stroke consistent with the rest.   
   
Could (always) be wrong, though ...
On second though, I think the connecting strokes were lengthened.

Mark's right: Gillies Gothic with lengthened connecting   
strokes. It often gets confused with Kaufmann and vice-versa.
Indeed, Gillies Gothic it is, thanks so much for your help! (Wow, your quickness in replying is rather astonishing, once again I thank you all! :-))
